intro: Pilosella tricholepia, commonly known as the hairy leaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are hairy and lobed, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Pilosella tricholepia is often found in disturbed habitats and can be an indicator of soil conditions.
